t: Job 36
Elihu Speaks of God’s Dealings with Men
Then*p Elihu continued and said,
“Wait*pn for me a little, and I will show you That*ln there is yet more to be said in God’s behalf.
I*ln will fetch my knowledge from afar, And*ln I will ascribe righteousness to my Maker.
For*ln truly my words are not false; One*ln who is perfect in knowledge is with you.
Behold,*ln God is mighty but does not despise any;*i He*iln is*i mighty in strength of understanding.
He*ln does not keep the wicked alive, But*ln gives justice to the afflicted.
He*ln does not withdraw His eyes from the righteous; But*ln with kings on the throne He*ln has seated them forever, and they are exalted.
And*ln if they are bound in fetters, And*ln are caught in the cords of affliction,
Then*ln He declares to them their work And*ln their transgressions, that they have magnified themselves.
He*ln opens their ear to instruction, And*ln commands that they return from evil.
If*ln they hear and serve Him,*i They*ln will end their days in prosperity And*ln their years in pleasures.
But*ln if they do not hear, they shall perish by the sword And*ln they will die without knowledge.
But*ln the godless in heart lay up anger; They*ln do not cry for help when He binds them.
They*ln die in youth, And*ln their life perishes*i among the cult prostitutes.
He*ln delivers the afflicted in their affliction, And*ln opens their ear in time*i of*i oppression.
Then*ln indeed, He enticed you from the mouth of distress, Instead*ln of it, a broad place with no constraint; And*ln that which was set on your table was full of fatness.
“But*ln you were full of judgment on the wicked; Judgment*ln and justice take hold of*i you.*i
Beware*iln that wrath does not entice you to scoffing; And*ln do not let the greatness of the ransom turn you aside.
Will*ln your riches keep you from distress, Or*ln all the forces of your*i strength?
Do*ln not long for the night, When*ln people vanish in their place.
Be*ln careful, do not turn to evil, For*ln you have preferred this to affliction.
Behold,*ln God is exalted in His power; Who*ln is a teacher like Him?
Who*ln has appointed Him His way, And*ln who has said, ‘You have done wrong’?
“Remember*ln that you should exalt His work, Of*ln which men have sung.
All*ln men have seen it; Man*ln beholds from afar.
Behold,*ln God is exalted, and we do not know Him;*i The*ln number of His years is unsearchable.
For*ln He draws up the drops of water, They*ln distill rain from the mist,
Which*ln the clouds pour down, They*ln drip upon man abundantly.
Can*ln anyone understand the spreading of the clouds, The*ln thundering of His pavilion?
Behold,*ln He spreads His lightning about Him, And*ln He covers the depths of the sea.
For*ln by these He judges peoples; He*ln gives food in abundance.
He*ln covers His*i hands with the lightning, And*ln commands it to strike the mark.
Its*ln noise declares His presence; The*ln cattle also, concerning what is coming up.
